clinical_study.brief_title: KLOS Study - Korean Medicine Registry for Low Back Pain Patients, a Prospective, Observational, Multicenter, Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: KLOS Study - Korean Medicine Registry for Low Back Pain Patients, a Prospective, Observational, Multicenter, Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Gachon University Gil Oriental Medical Hospital

collaborator.agency: Sangji University Oriental Medical Center, Korea
Semyung University Korean Medicine Hospital in Chungju, Korea
Kyung Hee University Oriental Medical Center, Korea
Woosuk University Oriental Medical Center, Korea
Dunsan Korean Medicine Hospital of Daejeon University,Korea
Pusan National University Korean Medicine Hospital, Korea

clinical_study.source: Gachon University Gil Oriental Medical Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The Purpose of this trial is to define the characteristics of the in/outpatients with low back pain in traditional Korean medicine rehabilitation clinic. This information will create a registry that will help us to compare similarities and differences in patients and their symptoms. The more patients the investigators are able to enter into the registry, the more the investigators will be able to understand the low back pain and learn better ways of caring for patients.

detailed_description.textblock: KLOS, prospective, multi-center, patient registry pilot study will collaborate with 7 Korean medicine hospitals and plan to recruit low back pain patients into the registry. 150 eligible patients with new episode of LBP who visit Korean medicine hospital without any other treatment history will enroll to the registry. After enrollment, study collect the individual characteristics of patient's status such as pain intensity, LBP related daily disability, anthropometrics, HRQoL at baseline, 30 and 90 days. We also access to the patient's clinical and administrative electronic records to analyze the pattern of patients' resource utilization. Overall, the aims of KLOS are to: 1) explore the general characteristics of new episode of LBP patients and; 2) evaluate the efficacy and safety of various Korean medicine treatments on low back pain based on nationwide registry outcome collecting process.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 'Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire'
primary_outcome.description: This is a self-reported questionnaire consisting of 24 items reflecting limitations in different activities of daily living attributed to low back pain including walking, bending over, sitting, lying down, dressing, sleeping, self-care and daily activities.

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 'Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire'
other_outcome.description: This is a self-reported questionnaire consisting of 24 items reflecting limitations in different activities of daily living attributed to low back pain

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Numeric Rating Scale of Pain
other_outcome.time_frame: at Baseline, 30 days after registration and 90 days after registration
other_outcome.description: A 10-point Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NRS; 0: no pain, 10: maximum pain) assesses the patients' current level of pain.

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in European Quality of life 5 Dimension
other_outcome.time_frame: at Baseline, 30 days after registration and 90 days after registration
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D is an international, standardized, generic instrument for describing and valuing health status. Participants were asked to indicate which of the following statements best describes their health state.

arm_group.description: Patients with low back pain in traditional Korean medicine rehabilitation clinic

intervention.intervention_name: expose to any drugs or procedures based on traditional Korean medicine theory
intervention.description: There are no specific interventions associated with this registry as it is purely observational study of medical utilization.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with low back pain who are visiting oriental rehabiliation clinic

overall_official.affiliation: Gachon University, Gil Oriental Medical Center

facility.name: Gachon University, Gil Oriental Medicine Center
